The BIGSHOT Inbound Guarantee

We set goals. We meet them. Then we have cake.

At BIGSHOT, we believe in putting our money where our mouth is. We believe in being held accountable for producing a positive ROI on your marketing investment with us. We thrive on doing excellent work and keeping the promises we make during our contract negotiation and extensive onboarding process. And because we are experts in inbound marketing and know what it takes to be successful for our clients, we feel very comfortable offering our written guarantee of results.

If BIGSHOT agrees to take you on as a client, we will work with you to analyze your current marketing initiatives and website, understand what kind of traffic you are getting to your site and how many sales qualified leads your site is converting every month. With that information we will work with you to establish a set of growth goals based on our monthly retainer and then agree in writing to be held accountable to achieving those goals.

We guarantee that If at 6 months we are not meeting the agreed upon goals, we will suspend the monthly retainer agreement and work for free, until we are back on goal, or for a maximum of 6 months. Once we are back on goal, the agreement will resume from the point of suspension, and run the full 12-month term of the agreement.

Why are we offering this kind of a guarantee? Unlike traditional outbound marketing, inbound marketing is largely data driven. As experts in inbound marketing we have studied our clients data for years and know exactly what it takes to craft and deliver successful inbound marketing campaigns.

Advertising is often looked at as an unquantifiable expense. At BIGSHOT we believe strongly that your monthly marketing budget is an investment in us for which we should return a positive ROI.

It’s time to start growing your business. Request a FREE custom inbound marketing proposal here or call 816-912-0659 and ask for more details. We look forward to hearing from you!

Client First

I grew up in an entrepreneurial family. My parents took a single tow truck and expanded it into one of the largest towing and recovery fleets in the midwest. They now run heavy duty tow trucks from coast to coast, and occasionally into Mexico and Canada. They didn’t build their business with Angel or VC money, they built it truck by truck and account by account. My Dad was the good ol’ boy shaking hands with the guys at the mechanic shops while my Mom graciously spoke with customers over the phone. They did what they said they were going to do, when they said they would do it. And, they never forgot that the customer is always right (even sometimes when they clearly aren’t).

BIGSHOT was built in the spirit of what I learned from my parents – their fanatical dedication to customer service. That dedication was indelibly imprinted on me, and I’m a better person and businessman for it. I never forgot that clients are real people and hard work is a part of creating great relationships.

BIGSHOT is a client-first agency. We take care of the client, then BIGSHOT, and finally ourselves. By doing so, and by serving our customers well, we ultimately serve ourselves.

In 1941, Kenneth B. Elliott from the Studebaker Car Company penned these words about clients, words that play a big part in shaping our core values here at BIGSHOT.

“It is, of course, not possible to state with any practical exactitude what the customer is. But there are several common denominators to be found when we consider the customer in terms of what he is not. These things, I think, are fundamental to intelligent customer relationship and, it may be added, most of them apply pretty well to the vast majority of prospects as well.

  1. The customer is not dependent upon us – we are dependent upon him.
  2. The customer is not an interruption of our work – he is the purpose of it.
  3. The customer is not a rank outsider to our business – he is a part of it.
  4. The customer is not a statistic – he is a flesh-and-blood human being completely equipped with biases, prejudices, emotions, pulse, blood chemistry and possibly a deficiency of certain vitamins.
  5. The customer is not someone to argue with or match wits against – he is a person who brings us his wants. If we have sufficient imagination, we will endeavor to handle them profitably to him and to ourselves.”

We hope to have the opportunity to apply these values to building your business and your dreams. Please call or email me so we can chat about how BIGSHOT might serve you.

Jeff Henry
President and Founder, BIGSHOT Inbound
816-912-0659
jeffh@thinkbigshot.com
